greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of eta(q)^3 * eta(q^5) * eta(q^10)^2 / eta(q^2)^2 in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
reference: S. Cooper, On Ramanujan's function k(q)=r(q)r^2(q^2), Ramanujan J., 20 (2009), 311-328; see p. 318 Th. 4.1
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of (phi(-q) * phi(-q^5)^3 - phi(-q)^3 * phi(-q^5)) / 4 in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 12 2012

Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^e if p=5, a(p^e) = -(p^(e+1) - 5*(-1)^e) / (p + 1) if p=2, a(p^e) = (p^(e+1) - 1) / (p - 1) if p == 1 or 9 (mod 10), a(p^e) = (p^(e+1) - (-1)^e) / (p + 1) if p == 3 or 7 (mod 10).
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, DivisorSum[ n, -(-1)^# # KroneckerSymbol[ 5, n/#] &]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jul 12 2012 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (1/4) (EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^5]^3 - EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q]^3 EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^5]), {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jul 12 2012 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, sumdiv( n, d, -(-1)^d * d * kronecker( n/d, 5)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<1, 0, n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^3 * eta(x^5 + A) * eta(x^10 + A)^2 / eta(x^2 + A)^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Aug 05 2005
